segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu … pe …
segments.en: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha …

segments.pli: ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavā etadavoca:
“katamā nu kho, bhikkhave, vedanā, katamo vedanāsamudayo, katamo vedanānirodho, katamā vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā?
segments.en: “Mendicants, what is feeling? What’s the origin of feeling? What’s the cessation of feeling? What’s the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling?

segments.pli: Ko vedanāya assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṃ nissaraṇan”ti?
segments.en: And what is feeling’s gratification, drawback, and escape?”
“Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”

segments.pli: sukhā vedanā, dukkhā vedanā, adukkhamasukhā vedanā—
imā vuccanti, bhikkhave, vedanā … pe … phassasamudayā … pe ….

segments.en: (This should be told in full as in the previous discourse.)

sections.title: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha ……

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha asks about the feelings to several mendicants in terms of arising, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.
